Media

Class Turtle

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • Media.Turtle

  • public class Turtle
extends java.util.Observable
    This class provides line drawing (vector graphics) capabilities based on Turtle Graphics (Seymour Papert). A Turtle draws on a Canvas on a BasicForm.
    Version:
    1.0 July 08
    Author:
    A. Cheesman

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int FAST 
      static int MEDIUM 
      static int SLOW 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Turtle()
      Creates a Turtle drawing at a slow speed with a black pen of width 1.
      Turtle(java.awt.Color c)
      Creates a Turtle drawing at slow speed with a pen of specified color and width 1.
      Turtle(int speed)
      Creates a Turtle drawing at a specified speed with a black pen of width 1.
      Turtle(int speed, java.awt.Color c)
      Creates a Turtle drawing at a specified speed with a pen of specified color and width 1.
      Turtle(int speed, int width)
      Creates a Turtle drawing at a specified speed with a black pen of specified width.
      Turtle(int speed, int width, java.awt.Color c)
      Creates a Turtle drawing at a specified speed with a pen of specified width and color.

      • right

        public void right(double newAngle)
        Changes the direction the turtle faces by newAngle radians to the right.
        Parameters:
        newAngle - the amount to increase the angle to the right

      • left

        public void left(double newAngle)
        Changes the direction the turtle faces by newAngle radians to the left.
        Parameters:
        newAngle - the amount to increase the angle to the left

      • setPenWidth

        public void setPenWidth(int x)
        Sets the width of the pen the turtle draws with. This method ensures you do not set the width < 1.
        Parameters:
        x - new width for the pen

      • getAngle

        public double getAngle()
        Returns the current angle the turtle is facing.
        Returns:
        double the angle (0-2pi) the turtle is facing.

        Returns the current color.
        Returns:
        Color the color of the pen.

      • setJFrame

        public void setJFrame(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        Used by BasicForm. Informs the Turtle what frame it is drawing on so that turtle movement is visible in real time.
        Parameters:
        frame - the frame the turtle is drawing on

      • setCanvas

        public void setCanvas(BasicIO.GeneralCanvas gc)
        Used by BasicForm. Informs the Turtle what camvas it is drawing on so that turtle movement is visible in real time.
        Parameters:
        gc - the canvas the turtle is drawing on
